instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Brain dead?
threads.message:
Hi guys, we sold this mac 6 month ago to trusted client.
The machine was before used in our store for almost one year without issues. Never repaired before...

Anyway... 
No post, No usb activity ,machine turns on , green and amber light , no fan spin but I assume that is normal on this model.
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> drop to low once and then says high. Cpu get warm after a while.
Fan goes high speed on SMC bypass but nothing happens.

I checked all the SPI lines and all resistors and everything is OK.
Also tried a good bin file and another chip from same model of donor board.
No signs of liquid damage or whatsoever... Everything seems in good shape.

Any clues?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Brain dead?
threads.message:
Do you get CPU core voltage?
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> comes high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Brain dead?
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>=1,69v 
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> act same as <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> : 3,3v when i connect magsafe, drop to 0v after few seconds and gets and stays high at 3,3v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Brain dead?
threads.message:
Looks like CPU issue.
Heat it for test; no more than 200 degrees, for 15-20s...
